poem:
### Frieze Epiphany

At Frieze, they gather in the aura,  
debating lines that rise like spears.  
Freedom, they declare, from form,  
yet bound in colors ancient as dust.

The artist's hand, a whisper of time,  
paints silence into shouting eyes.  
Eureka rests in softened shades,  
art's soul unveiled through curious gaze.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I’m waiting for that eureka moment’: I join a £40,000 hunt for some Frieze masterpieces A group of women are gathered around a stunning watercolour, arguing about all the erections it contains. “It’s nothing you wouldn’t see on ancient Greek pottery,” says one. “I think it symbolises freedom,” ventures another. But Harriet Loffler has reservations. She loves the piece we’re viewing here at Frieze art fair in London: a painting by Chinese artist Shafei Xia". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
